title: "Reconnect to previously opened sessions on startup" option doesn't work
author: crispy9352
body_snippet:
"Reconnect to previously opened sessions on startup" option doesn't work. Steps to reproduce:

1. Stop mRemoteNG
2. Uninstall mRemoteNG
3. Delete folder "%APPDATA%\mRemoteNG"
4. Delete folder "%LOCALAPPDATA%\mRemoteNG"
5. Delete folder "%ProgramFiles(x86)%\mRemoteNG"
6. Install mRemoteNG
7. Start mRemoteNG
8. Click "Use the recommended settings"
9. Enable option "Save connections on exit"
10. Enable option "Reconnect to previously opened sessions on startup"
11. Enable option "For em...

iterations.description: Startup reconnect currently only reopens persisted tree nodes (`PleaseConnect`) and ignores Quick Connect sessions, so adding lightweight Quick Connect session persistence will make the option behave as users expect.
The startup reconnect flow currently only reopens persisted tree nodes and does not persist enough data to rehydrate open Quick Connect sessions.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
This issue is happening at step 13. Since quick connect entries are not saved anywhere, there is no way to reopen the connection (we have no idea what the hostname was). We would need to change how the "Reconnect to previously opened sessions on startup" option is implemented to make this work. 

This would be new functionality as no previous version ever supported reconnecting to quick connect entries.

notes:
AI triage (codex): Startup reconnect currently only reopens persisted tree nodes (`PleaseConnect`) and ignores Quick Connect sessions, so adding lightweight Quick Connect session persistence will make the option behave as users expect.
Approach: Persist minimal metadata for active Quick Connect sessions on exit and replay them during startup reconnect, plus tests for mixed saved and quick-connect sessions.
AI triage (gemini): The startup reconnect flow currently only reopens persisted tree nodes and does not persist enough data to rehydrate open Quick Connect sessions.
Approach: Persist metadata for open Quick Connect sessions on shutdown and extend startup reconnect logic to recreate and open those quick sessions alongside normal saved connections.
